title: New Product Development and Launch
description: Project-based skills for developing new products and planning for their launch. Major phases of new product development: opportunity identification and analysis, idea identification and selection, concept development, product design and positioning, pre-market testing and planning for the launch. Introduction to data-gathering methods used to design successful new products. 4 lectures.
prerequisites: BUS 418, STAT 252; Business and Economics majors must have formally declared their concentration to enroll
